intro: Acronia stevensonii, commonly known as the Stevenson's acronia, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and the plant produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Acronia stevensonii is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
